DataElement.preferredDefinition: the time related to the execution of Melphalan to a solution intended for reconstitution before administration.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the execution of Melphalan to a solution intended for reconstitution before administration.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A drug or substance that treats or prevents or alleviates the symptoms of disease.

Concepts.definition: A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredName: Melphalan Solution for Reconstitution Dosage Form Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: An orally available phenylalanine derivative of nitrogen mustard with antineoplastic activity. Melphalan alkylates DNA at the N7 position of guanine and induces DNA inter-strand cross-linkages, resulting in the inhibition of DNA and RNA synthesis and cytotoxicity against both dividing and non-dividing tumor cells. (NCI04):A solution intended for reconstitution before administration.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A phenylalanine derivative of nitrogen mustard with antineoplastic activity. Melphalan alkylates DNA at the N7 position of guanine and induces DNA inter-strand cross-linkages, resulting in the inhibition of DNA and RNA synthesis and cytotoxicity against both dividing and non-dividing tumor cells.
A solution intended for reconstitution before administration.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
